instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
1. PPBUS_G3H - Yes
2. PP3V42_G3H - Yes
3. PP5V_S3 - no
4. PP5V_S0 - no

External 5V - works

I have no 5v on the board.
Where I start to measure?

Thank you

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: I'd start digging around U7201 / TPS51125

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Do you have PP3V3_S5_REG? If it is there, check if you have a working keyboard or use power pads on the board

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
Ignore U7201/TPS51125 and do not touch it.

PP1V05_S5_MCP is measuring what voltage? 0.316v, or 1.05v? Ifit is 1.05v, does it drop when you try to turn it on?

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Thank you guys, I will try do that.

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Louis, i have on PP1V05_S5_MCP 1.17v

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: PP1V05_S5_MCP 1.17v

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: PM_SLP_S4_L going up when you hit the power button?

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: My first question would be if PP3V3_S5 from TPS51125 is present.

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, PP3V3_S5 is present, Duke.

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: No, I don't get  nothing.

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, PP3V3_S5 is present, Duke.

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: When you hit the power button does pm_pwrbtn_l change?

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Also important on 15" models is that you use a known good 85W charger. Check on a working macbook if it really is recognized as 85W and not a Chinese fake one!

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Nothing, Louis.

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, the charge is 85W  (original)

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
I got the same board with same symptoms here, no liquid damage:

PP5V_S3 - [U]no[/U]
PP5V_S0 - [U]no[/U]
PP3V3_S5 - [U]present[/U]
PP1V05_S5_MCP - [U]1.16v [/U]
pm_slp_s4_l - [U]missing[/U]
no shorts to GND

what could it be?
Maybe a clock issue?

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message:
Please no thread hijacking, first want to solve the OP problem. 
Is SMC_ADAPTER_EN high?

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: So if you put 5V with your external power supply it works??

threads.title: 820-2532 - A green light but wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, works!
